result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon J. Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Will be added to current plan

Defendant to commence his sentence on or before 06/09/2015 no later than 8:00 pm   Huber granted.  AMENDED  06/04/2015  The defendant may serve his sentence in Taylor County, privilege of transfer is denied if it results in electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon J. Allen

records.addlTxt: to serve jail sentence in Taylor County - granted JOC Amended
Prosecutor Lyndsey A.B. Brunette and Defendant, Brandon J. Allen appeared, pro se    Defendant finalized  waiver of  right to an attorney after full colloquy
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 10, 2015 at 02:40 pm.
Prosecutor Lyndsey A.B. Brunette and Defendant, Brandon J. Allen appeared, pro se  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 02:40 pm.

Pre-trial conference on February 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on February 26, 2015 at 01:20 pm.
THE DEFENDANT ENTERED A PLEA OF NOT GUILTY

The defendant shall have no contact with L.H.  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant is not to on or around the premises of 141 N Main Street, Loyal WI.   Defendant may go through a third party not more than two times a week to make arrangements to retrieve personal belongings and for child visitation/placement.    Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  THE DEFENDANT ENTERED A PLEA OF NOT GUILTY  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 01:20 pm.
